main event: Eight unidentified objects were observed traveling from East to West over Selfridge AFB, Michigan, on April 12, 1958.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 2 minutes., Two large objects were noted, from which six smaller objects emerged., The observed objects were orange in color and left vapor trails., The case was considered unreliable due to insufficient data and late reporting., Comments from the report stated that the objects' true nature could possibly be balloons or aircraft.
sighted object: two large and six small orange objects
witness description: observation from the ground with visual confirmation
